metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29900 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mis-trained branch predictions for return instructions may allow arbitraryspeculative code execution under certain microarchitecture-dependentconditions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-46.49
linux-image-5.15.0-46-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-46.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-46.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-generic-64k - 5.15.0-46.49
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1016-kvm - 5.15.0-1016.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1017-aws - 5.15.0-1017.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1017-azure - 5.15.0-1017.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1017.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1016-gcp - 5.15.0-1016.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1014-gke - 5.15.0-1014.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-gkeop - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1012-ibm - 5.15.0-1012.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1013-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1013.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-lowlatency - 5.15.0-46.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-46.49
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1016-oracle - 5.15.0-1016.20
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1013-raspi - 5.15.0-1013.15
linux-image-5.15.0-1013-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1013.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-46.49').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1016.19').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1017.21').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1017.20').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1017.20').
linux-gcp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1016.21').
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1014.17').
linux-gkeop package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.4').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1012.14').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1013.17').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-46.49').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1016.20').
linux-oem-5.17: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needed').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1013.15').
linux-oem-6.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needs-triage').
